definition: abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan
classics/sacred book/scripture/to pass through/to undergo/to bear/to endure/warp (textile)/longitude/menstruation/channel (TCM)/abbr. for economics 經濟|经济[jing1 ji4]
finger/to point at or to/to indicate or refer to/to depend on/to count on/(of hair) to stand on end
to count/to count as/to regard as/to enumerate (sb's shortcomings)

sentences.english: It was the biggest one-day loss for the Nikkei since 1987.
sentences.chinese: 这是日经指数1987年以来最大单日跌幅。

sentences.english: In Asia - Tokyo's Nikkei was up nearly 3 percent.
sentences.chinese: 在亚洲，东京日经指数上涨了近3个百分点。

sentences.english: In Japan, the Nikkei Index was down by almost 3% in midafternoon .
sentences.chinese: 日本的日经指数在正午下降了大约3%。

sentences.english: The Nikkei is also climbing mostly upwards.
sentences.chinese: 与此同时，日经指数也正在向上爬升。

sentences.english: Japan's Nikkei Index closed less than one percent higher Friday.
sentences.chinese: 日本日经指数星期五以上升不到一个百分点收盘。

sentences.english: It was down as much as 454 points, or 5%, before rebounding.
sentences.chinese: 反弹前，日经指数已下跌454点，跌幅达5%。
